element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm calculates an accumulated cost surface from an unitary cost layer, assuming that the cost is isotropic (the cost of crossing each cell is the same in all directions). The value in each result cell is the cost up to the closest destination point.

element.name: COST
element.text: Values in this layer represent the cost of crossing each cell

element.name: FEATURES
element.text: Desstination points are represented as cells with any valid value. Remaining cells must have the no-data value.

element.name: DISTANCE
element.text: The way to compute distance between cells. The following options are available: * Euclidean * Chessboard * Manhattan * Chamfer 3:4 * 5 X 5

element.name: ACCCOST
element.text: The accumulated cost surface. The values in this layer indicate the cost to the closest destination point.

element.name: CLOSESTPOINT
element.text: The values in this layer indicate the number that idetifies the closest point. Cells with the same values in this layer have the same destination point as their closests one.
